thread.title: Karl Rove: Hillary Has Enough Money, Resources, Name Value & Backing From President Obama To Survive The Primary
thread.title_full: Karl Rove: Hillary Has Enough Money, Resources, Name Value & Backing From President Obama To Survive The Primary

author: FOX News Talk
title: Karl Rove: Hillary Has Enough Money, Resources, Name Value & Backing From President Obama To Survive The Primary
text:
John Gibson Aug 3, 2015 
Karl Rove , Fox News Contributor and Former Deputy Chief of Staff and Senior Advisor to President George W. Bush, joined Gibson to preview Thursday nights GOP debate on Fox News, Donald Trump and the possibility of Joe Biden running in 2016. 
Listen here: Listen to audio clip. 
Rove believes the talk of Joe Biden running is a symptom of Hillary Clintons problems and wouldn’t be surprised if by September, Biden is seriously considering a run. Turning to Hillary, Rove believes besides a potential Biden run, Bernie Sanders can present trouble for her in Iowa and New Hampshire because of the far left primary voters. At the end of the day, Rove said Hillary has enough money, resources, name value and backing from President Obama to win the nomination. However, Rove points out Hillary has a problem in a general election because of her poor numbers on being trustworthy, and being in touch with average American’s. 
Turning to Donald Trump and Thursday’s debates, Rove said Trump is riding the wave of angry voters who want someone outside of politics running for president. Rove cautioned Trump supporters that he has the highest negative ratings among all republican candidates. Votes have to ask themselves if they can see Trump in the oval office making the tough decisions.
